entries.title: US Supreme Court upholds controversial Title 42 border policy
entries.description: Invoked under the Trump administration, Title 42 uses public health as a justification for expelling asylum seekers.

entries.title: UN Security Council denounces Taliban bans against women
entries.description: The 15-member council said the ban would have a significant effect on humanitarian operations in country.

entries.title: GOP congressman-elect admits he made up key details of life story
entries.description: George Santos, elected to US House of Representatives from New York, made false claims about education, work history.

entries.title: Photos: Climate crisis threatens centuries-old oases in Morocco
entries.description: Hundreds of people from the oasis areas have fled to the cities, mainly because of frequent droughts.

entries.title: Russia bans oil sales to nations, firms complying with price cap
entries.description: Moscow's response to the Western price cap is to stop supplying crude oil and oil products from February 1.

entries.title: Russia bans oil sales to nations, firms complying with price cap
entries.description: Moscow's response to the Western price cap is to stop supplying crude oil and oil products from February 1.

entries.title: Leader in plot to kidnap US governor sentenced to 16 years
entries.description: Prosecutors say Adam Fox was 'driving force' behind conspiracy to kidnap Democratic Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer.

entries.title: What are implications of military tensions on Korean Peninsula?
entries.description: South Korea's president calls for better military defences after North Korean drones breach its airspace.

entries.title: ‘Heartbreaking’: New York surveys damage after historic blizzard
entries.description: Toll in US city of Buffalo hits 27, mayor says, as residents urged to stay home while crews clear snow-covered roads.

entries.title: In 2022, sport brought every imaginable emotion
entries.description: Be it joy or pain, exhilaration or anguish, relief or regret, sport inspired a wide range of feelings.

entries.title: India probing wealthy Russian politician’s fall to death at hotel
entries.description: Billionaire Pavel Antov's death came two days after another member of his party was found dead at the same hotel.

entries.title: Spain announces $10bn aid package in bid to ease inflation pain
entries.description: Measures come as Madrid grapples with a cost-of-living crisis exacerbated by the economic fallout from the Ukraine war.

entries.title: On the road in San Francisco, riding in a driverless taxi
entries.description: Autonomous vehicles from companies like Waymo and Cruise make inroads on California streets, despite safety concerns.

entries.title: As COVID-hit China opens up to travel, others secure their doors
entries.description: Japan joined India Tuesday in imposing restrictions on Chinese visitors as Beijing relaxed its norms for travellers.

entries.title: Ethnic Serbs erect more roadblocks as tensions soar in Kosovo
entries.description: Kosovo has demanded barriers erected by Serb protesters be removed while Serbia has put its army on high alert.

entries.title: In 2022, Kenya celebrated the Queen and forgot its own struggle
entries.description: Kenyans marked the Platinum Jubilee of the British queen but ignored the 70th anniversary of the KLFA rebellion. Why?

entries.title: Israel announces arrest of November Jerusalem bombing suspect
entries.description: Islam Faroukh, a Palestinian mechanical engineer, was arrested a few days after November's bombing attacks in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Netanyahu closer to far-right Israel gov’t with new legislation
entries.description: Amendments include revising ministerial fitness standards, meaning officials with suspended sentences can serve in gov't

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Living Through Conflict
entries.description: “There's a sense of civic duty.”

entries.title: How much money has the West spent on the Ukraine war?
entries.description: A German research institute is tracking the funding flowing to Kyiv from its allies as Russia's offensive grinds on.

entries.title: Ethiopian Airlines to resume flights into Tigray region
entries.description: The flights resume as Tigray is reconnected to the national power grid and telecoms services are being restored there.

entries.title: US probes ‘unacceptable’ Southwest Airlines mass cancellations
entries.description: Airline cancels more than two-thirds of scheduled flights over Christmas break amid a devastating winter storm.

entries.title: Japan PM sacks fourth minister from scandal-hit cabinet
entries.description: Reconstruction minister Kenya Akiba has been accused of violating election law and of ties with the Unification Church.

entries.title: ‘Communion with creatives’: Literary events flourish in Nigeria
entries.description: New literary festivals are springing up in Nigeria, inspiring an evolving community of more book-loving Africans.

entries.title: ‘Communion with creatives’: Literary events flourish in Nigeria
entries.description: New literary festivals are springing up in Nigeria, inspiring an evolving community of more book-loving Africans.

entries.title: City of God, 20 years on
entries.description: The Brazilian crime epic is more relevant today than ever before.

entries.title: Why do the rich get richer — even during global crises?
entries.description: Every 30 hours, the pandemic spawned a new billionaire, while pushing a million people into poverty. Here's why.

entries.title: Why are North Korea’s drones spooking the South?
entries.description: South Korea's military failed to shoot down five drones on Monday, sparking national concern amid rising tensions.

entries.title: Second boat with 185 Rohingya arrives in Indonesia’s Aceh
entries.description: The boat came ashore in Ujong Pie village, a day after a wooden vessel with 57 Rohingya landed in another part of Aceh.

entries.title: Zimbabwe’s pool players aim for success
entries.description: Pool gained popularity over the years, first as a pastime and now as a survival mode, as people bet money to pay bills.

entries.title: What will 2023 bring for Iran and its protest movement?
entries.description: Iran is heading into 2023 amid continuing protests and fraught relations with the West.

entries.title: Modern Peanuts of Cameroon: Selling with style
entries.description: Hassan Mounpé is a man with big plans for his small peanut-selling business.

entries.title: Ten civilians killed in Burkina Faso after bus hits landmine
entries.description: The deaths are the latest linked to the growing influence of armed rebels fighting the country's government.

entries.title: Guerrilla Garden: A food forest in Cape Town
entries.description: Plants, produce and empowerment – a collective response to a community’s needs in Cape Town, South Africa.

entries.title: South Korea’s jailed ex-president Lee gets presidential pardon
entries.description: South Korean President  Yoon Seok-yeol issues pardons for more than 1,300 people in bid for 'national unity.'

entries.title: Philippines flood death toll rises, search continues for missing
entries.description: Flash floods caused by heavy rains disrupt Christmas celebrations, with more than 45,000 people seeking shelter.

entries.title: A Stone Crusher’s Song: A Nigerian grandmother-turned-singer
entries.description: A grandmother in Jos, Nigeria goes from breaking rocks for a living to rocking social media with her song.

entries.title: Taiwan said to extend military service as China dials up pressure
entries.description: Taiwan's president is expected to announce that compulsory military service will increase from four months to one year.

entries.title: Ukraine pitches peace conference even as Russia issues threat
entries.description: Ukraine's foreign minister said the country wanted a UN peace summit by February, but it is unlikely Russia will join.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 307
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 307th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Death toll from Christmas rains, floods in Philippines now at 13
entries.description: Torrential rains forced more than 45,000 people into evacuation centres, most of the missing believed to be fishers.

entries.title: North Korea’s Kim hails economic, military successes at meeting
entries.description: North Korean leader says isolated state has increased economic and military power at opening of key annual gathering.

entries.title: Russia’s Lavrov issues ultimatum to Ukraine: ‘For your own good’
entries.description: Fulfil Moscow's demands, 'otherwise, the issue will be decided by the Russian army', Russia's foreign minister said.

entries.title: China’s industrial profits sink in deepening slump
entries.description: Industrial profits fell 3.6 percent in January-November from a year earlier, government data shows.

entries.title: Serbian troops on Kosovo border in state of ‘combat readiness’
entries.description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic has ordered that 'all measures be taken to protect the Serbian people in Kosovo'.

entries.title: Iranian football legend Ali Daei says family ordered off flight
entries.description: Former international striker said his wife and daughter were travelling from Tehran to Dubai when flight was diverted.
